algorithms

Class Algorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.Algorithm
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CoTraining, MajorityVote, RSSalg, SupervisedAlgorithm_All, SupervisedAlgorithm_L

    public abstract class Algorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class representing an algorithm that can be run. This class should be inherited when adding a new algorithm.
    Author:
    Jelena Slivka

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        public CoTrainingData getData()
        Returns the current state of data (labeled, unlabeled and test data)
        Returns:
        data for semi-supervised experiment (labeled, unlabeled and test data)

      • run

        public ClassificationResult run(CoTrainingData data,
                       int fold,
                       int splitNo,
                       boolean recordClassifiers)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Run the algorithm
        Parameters:
        data - separated labeled, unlabeled and test data
        fold - current fold of the n-fold-cross validation
        splitNo - the current feature split run for the fold (e.g. in RSSalg for each fold, m feature splits are created for co-training)
        recordClassifiers - whether to record statistics about building and testing each of the classifiers (see getClassifiers() and getClassifiersTestData())
        Returns:
        Classification result. The performance of the algorithm is evaluated on the test set defined in CoTrainingData object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there was an error running an algorithm

      • getClassifiers

        public ClassifierEnsembleList getClassifiers()
        Returns the statistics about building each of the classifiers. Statistics: information about each instance labeled during the training process of the classifier (instances formally belonging to the unlabeled set, labeled and added to train data by the algorithm) - instance id, assigned label, confidence for each prediction. For example, in RSSalg multiple co-training classifiers are built. Statistics about building these classifiers is recorded in the ClassifierEnsembleList object and is later used for building the final training set in RSSalg.
        Returns:
        records about building a classifier (by labeling instances form unlabeled data and transferring them to the labeled set)

      • getClassifiersTestData

        public ClassifierEnsembleList getClassifiersTestData()
        Returns the statistics about testing each of the trained classifiers. Statistics: information about each instance from the test set labeled during the algorithm evaluation - instance id, assigned label, confidence for each prediction. For example, in MajorityVote multiple co-training classifiers are built. Each trained classifier is then applied to the test set and statistics about testing these classifiers is recorded in the ClassifierEnsembleList object. This statistics is later used for labeling test instances by a simple majority vote of the created classifiers.
        Returns:
        records about evaluating a classifier on the test data

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the algorithm
        Returns:
        name of the algorithm.

      • getRunningTimeMillis

        public long getRunningTimeMillis()
        Returns the algorithm running time. Running time is the time needed for the execution of run(algorithms.co_training.CoTrainingData, int, int, boolean) method.
        Returns:
        running time of the algorithm
